text: Tap at cigar city, tampa. Black color, tanned head. Nice roasty aroma has coffee and some milky notes. Nice roasty body, lots of coffee, espresso.

Draft @ Brewery. Pours a nice pitch black beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma has roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate and hint of toast. Flavor is very strong and firm, roasty sweetness with roasted caramel in the background and more ground coffee in the front. Very malty, strong and full bodied. Very nice stuff.

Draft @ CCB.
Brune fin, col beige.
Arôme au bouquet agréable malté grillé prononcé mais légèrement doux rappelant un CCB Cubano avec ce grillé plus présent et moins centré sur le café.
Palais est doux grillé malts pils et Munich-cara avec une pointe de café, fini poudreux tirant vers un stout, fine amertume des houblons sur la fin ajoutant une impression de citronné et fleuri.
Really nice rich chocolatey lager. Nothing particularly smokey from this, but light sweetness and very pleasant.
Toasty and very drinkable. Black pour with OK head. Some bitterness in crisp finish. Lots of raw barley aroma.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey for the Cigar City & Funky Buddha SAVOR event. Black with light tan head. Aromas of smoke, roast. Tastes of smoke, caramel, toffee, roast. Medium body with a dry finish.
Sample. Dark brown color with off white head. Coffee aroma. Taste is dry coffee and nutty. Nice.

Tasted on 5/26/12 from a growler, thanks to Nick. Pours completely opaque black with a thin beige head that leaves a thin collar of lace. The nose is full of coffee and dark chocolate with a nice bitter green hops aroma. The flavor is nice and dry with coffee, dusty dark chocolate, and the green, nicely bitter hops. The body is medium with average, stinging carbonation, and a long bitter dark chocolate and coffee finish.
Pours a dark brown color with off-white head. Dark malts, cereal grains, and some bread and biscuit on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with roasted malt.

Dark black, almost opaque pour. Lots of grains and maltiness with a roasted presence in the aroma. Taste was much crisper bringing in a slight hop bite to match biscuit, coffee, and chocolate flavors. Light and drinkable for being so rich. Very good.

Shaker pint draft at the Brass Tap in Coral Springs, Florida. The pour is a dark brown black with a one inch khaki head that falls quick. The aroma is soft roast and char nutty malt. The taste is the clean fresh nutty malt with the char roast of the nose. The palate is medium to light bodied with active carbonation and a mineral soft roast dry finish. Clean and very well made.
On tap at the brewery. Comes dark brown with a nice beige head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, coffee, and smoke. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, caramel, pine, and smoke. Very good.

En fût au Riverside Market Cafe. Un verre presque noir. Une petite tête brune bien droite. Des parfums de malts chocolatés rôtis avec des traces de café, du caramel terreux, de la fine fumée de torréfaction et des arômes de conifères. Des saveurs bien sèches de grains noirs grillés et rôtis avec une petite présence de fumée et des traces de houblons américains et anglais. En bouche, un corps moyen avec un pétillement au ralenti et une texture bien crémeuse. Une finale chocolatée justement sèche. Une belle surprise. Très facile à boire.

I love this style and was happy to try this one from CCB. Hot and Soul in Ft. Lauderdale with Dan and Roxy. Pint glass pour was very dark, mostly opaque. Off-white head that lasted and not much lacing. Aroma of heavy roasted malts, earth, peat, leather, balancing hops with slight pine and grass. Taste was similar with a malty thickness to it. Roasted malts, salt, nuts, cocoa. Medium to full body and good carbonation. I loved it.

Clear, black, but hard to see through. Khaki, short, tight head. Muted pencil shaving aroma. Malty, slightly roasty, sunflower seed flavors. Good mouth, satisfying balance. I could drink a mess of this. Sweetish, smooth, with a good bit of roastiness. Proof on tap, downstairs with PorterPounder.

Have wanted to try this one for a while. Black pour, thin tan head, little lacing. Nose is biscuit, roasted grains, slight hop presence. Taste is biscuit, roasted grains, some watered down coffee. Thin to medium mouthfeel.

A: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes No Light, Thick Creamy Off White Head, Great Lacing

S: Dark Mildly Roasted Chocolate Malts, Mild Coffee, Mild Caramel

T: Dark Roasted Malts, Chocolate, Coffee

M: Great Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Mildly Malty, Mildly Sticky

Overall, a pretty solid black lager made better with the nitro tap, added creaminess and smoothed out the flavors.

Best beer I have ever had ... Cigar City, PLEASE start making this again!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft at Churchkey in D.C.

The beer is dark brown with a small tan head. The aroma is roasty, with notes of coffee and chocolate. Nice tasting beer. Light and simple. Easy drinking. A touch of hop bitterness in the finish. Well balanced. This is a nice brew that I wouldnt mind drinking again.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 07-04-2012
GABF, 2012. Clearly recognizable lager yeast.  Rich palate with roasted malt, very full flavored. Grain finish. A very good session beer.
On tap at GABF 2012. Pours a clear brown color with a medium tan head. A big nose of sweet smoke and malts. A easygoing flavor with light metal and smoke, some toast and candies. Good. Clean.
On tap locally. Pours dark brown with a creamy head. Chocolate, coffee grounds, and some roast in the aroma. Very strong coffee taste, nicely bitter. Medium body, good carbonation.

On draught at Freshcraft during the Cigar City Reception. Black pour with some brown around the edges and a medium tan head that recedes steadily. Aroma of toasted malt, pine and hops. Light-bodied with a sweet roasted malt and resiny hops flavor. Notes of coffee and chocolate as well. The finish is roasty with an herbal hops aftertaste. Pretty good overall.

Pours a translucent brownish-black on tap with a thin tan head and light lacing. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, and coffee. Taste follows suit, but not offensive, well balanced. Good stuff, and a unique style.

The 32oz swing top growler, courtesy of markwise, pours nice and dark with light colored mocha head. The aroma offers up dark roasted malts, a bit of spicy black licorice and then a very light note of a sour almost soured milk note. The taste delivers a similar experience only in flavor form with dark roasted malts, some burnt malts, black licorice and then an interesting slightly soured yeastiness. Cool stuff.

Shared by ibrew2or3 at a recent tasting.  Pour is dark brown with a tan head.  Aroma is roasty, smokey, coffee and light chocolate.  Taste is similar with the roast coming out, and a dry finish.  Good stuff.
Nice pour from ibrew2or3.  Dark brown, light tan head.  Light roast, smoke, some dark fruit and coffee notes. Flavor is dry, toasty, coffee, and smoke.

Served on draft at Mekong Richmond, VA. Pours a clear very dark brown head with a thin creamy tan head. Decent head retention. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate and nutty notes. The taste is very similar with some berries and bitter hops. Medium bodied, well balanced. Nice beer.

Draft. Great example of the style. Big, roasty malt aroma with coffee, chocolate, and a hint of smoke. Big tan head. Taste is rich, creamy, light and refreshing. Theres chocolate, coffee, vanilla, and crisp malt. Not too sweet.

Pours a dark back with a thick mocha head. Aroma of coffee, smoke and chocolate. Taste follows, roast is nice, not over the top. Smooth and very drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Tampa airport. Body is dark brown with a tan head and aromas of... well... Kalamata olives and chocolate. Messed up, huh?  I let it warm, still olives. It doesnt show up in the flavor however as this is a silky chocolate beer from start to finish. This is an excellent schwarz.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 4oz pour at Churchkey is a murky, transparent black with some creamy white head.  Malty nose, light smoke, dark chocolate.  Flavor is malty, stale licorice, smoke, coffee grounds.  Medium bodied, sweet finish.  Just too sweet.
Draft.  Minimal tan head, black body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, milk chocolate, some caramel.  Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, milk chocolate, some lager yeast.  Medium body, some stickiness.
On tap at Churckey for the Funky Buddha event. Smokey malts and caramel toffee with espresso grounds and bitter bakers chocolate. Delicious.

Draft at Churchkey for the Bluejacket/Funky Buddha/Cigar City event during SAVOR week. Poured a dark color, almost black, with a light brown color. Aroma was chocolate, caramel, toffee perhaps. Smoke notes are pretty well balanced.
jet black color, aroma of fresh ground coffee, chocolate, flavors of coffee, chocolate, burnt caramel, slightly watery, light body
Near opaque black showing red-brown. Aroma is dark malt, dry roast choc, caramel, brandy. Flavor is caramel and cocoa powder, dry finish. A little pep at the end.

Tap at Funky Buddha. It pours jet black, with a thick tan head. The nose is roasted malt, freshly ground coffee and dark chocolate. The taste is cocoa powder, caramel, roasted malt, charcoal, wood, dark chocolate and coffee, with a dry-roasted finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and velvety mouth-feel. Good balance, not overly complex, but tasty. A very good schwarzbier.
Deep black color, eggshell head. Aroma is roasted malt. Flavor is a very dry bitter roasted malt and coffee. This is pretty rough, not an easy drinking lager.
On draft at Charm City Burgers. Dark brown/black color with a thin brownish head. Nice pleasant aroma of chocolate and woody characters. Flavor is a little charred but still very enjoyable.
Draft at the source. Almost black, beige edge head. Aroma of burnt chocilate and caramel. Taste is toasted cocoa. Decent.

Tap at CCB. Deep brown to ruby with no head. Nose is sharper coffee roast and dark cherries. Taste follows suit: heavy baked cherries followed by heavy coffee and roasted malt. Medium mouthfeel with good bitterness. Easy to drink. Heavy coffee presence. Successful. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Moderate malt aroma of toasted, light to moderate herbs and resin for the hops, light earth for the yeast, with charcoal, licorice, milk and a hint of vinegar in the background.. Head is small, frothy, light tan with no lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is very dark brown. Flavor starts lightly sweet and lightly to moderately acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and moderately acidic and bitter. Palate is medium, oily with a soft to lively carbonation. A rich and bold Schwarzbier with a few tart notes.

Draft. Black with good, creamy, tan head / Nose of toasted barley and tobacco / Medium, creamy body with modest acidity and long, dry, bitter finish / Very smooth flavors of dark roast coffee and tobacco, with a hint of dark caramel / Near perfect for this style.
Pours opaque black with beige head.  Good lacing, medium body, low carbonation, and sweet roasted aroma.  Taste is sweet roasted malt and a light bitter hop finish.  I like this one.
Black pour with a nice nose of roasted malts.Taste is nice mix of roast and a little sweetness. Nice hops on finish. Solid CC brew.

Tap @ Redlight Redlight. Pours pitch black with a nice tanned head. Aroma is roasted malty fruity sweet bready. Flavor is fruity lightly roasted malty, lightly bitter a bit smokey. Finishes dry fruity malty.

On tap at Redlight Redlight, poured as a half liter with very little head. Very sweet aroma, almost lactose like. Smooth like a nitro stout, a nice residual sweetness that Im really enjoying. Unlike any Lager Ive ever had, very rich and delicious.

Draught.  Dark brown and slightly reddish.  Very toasty aroma, though this is served pretty cold.  The palate is quite toasty with some complex darker malts.  The body is full, and a little bit smoky. Finishes dry.  Good schwarzbier.

Another huge mug pour at redlight... Pours a mostly darker stouty black pour with less intense deep reddish semi-tan edges and topped with an enticing creamy light beige head... Aroma of roasted grain and cocoa throughout. Solid with a touch of  burnt ends... Flavors are solidly mire if the same with a solid roast and cocoa flavor profile. Easy goin body with mild to medium carbonation. Pretty darn drinkable.

Review from notes at World of Beer - Fort Myers on 11/19/11.

Poured on draft into a shaker pint. 

Appearance: Pours a dark cola brown with a 1/2 finger grey-tan head. Nice lacing.

Smell: Dark brewed coffee and toasted malt with a touch of sweetness.

Taste: Toasted malt up front followed by earthy hops and a German grainy quality in the middle before ending with a lightly sweet finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-to-full-bodied with good carbonation. Very thick for a beer with 5.5% ABV.

Drinkability: Good drinkability. You could have a few without much difficulty.

Overall: Good beer overall. Not Cigar Citys best beer by far, but its still worth a shot.

Tallahassee, Fl. - on tap - Fermentation Lounge. Dark, black as coal pour with a thick mocha colored head that leaves plenty of lacing. Aroma is very deliciously fragrant with some chicory, licorice and creosote notes. Flavor starts out with some smooth espresso notes, some unsweetened chocolate, finish has some cookie notes to it - similar to a biscotti, a hint of licorice to round it out - very flavorful. Thick, rich mouthfeel. Very solid.
On tap at Proof.  Black pour with a thin off-white.  Roasty malt and smoke aroma.  Tastes are toasted grain, coffee, caramel, chocolate and hint of smoke.  Drinkable -thin palate.  Nice.

Draft @ Cervesas. Black, deep. Tan head. Aroma has pasteli carob candy, cola, prunes, nice complex mix. A slight bit of butteriness. Great carbo level. Licorice, prunes, earth, and a clean almost abrupt finish that makes it moreish. Fruity, rich, and solid.

Fat Lost Kangaroo. Svart öl med rubinröda tendenser i ljuset. Doft av rostad malt och kaffe. Ovanligt mycket kaffe i smaken för att vara en Schwarzbier. Smaken påminner mer om en stout om än inte lika fyllig och torr. God.

On draft at the Brass Tap, pours a dark brown, almost black color, aromas of roasted malt, chocolate, herbs, and a smidge of smoke.  FLavor is much the same, huge malty flavor, really nice beer overall.
On tap at WOB - Clematis.  Dark brown pour with an off white head.  Dark roasted malt and sweet smoke aromas.  Good mouthfeel, with all kinds of dark roasted malt and coffee notes..

Growler from Cigar City. This one pours a nice a dark, black color with a touch of mahogany at the edges and crowned by a thick mocha colored head of foam that shows good retention. The head leaves scattered splotches of lace around the glass as it slowly settles to a thin film. The aroma shows a big roasty character hinting at dry chocolate and mocha mostly along with notes of coffee and toasted caramel malt. Just a hint of bitterness creeps in the back end from some piney hops. The aroma is very nicely balanced. The flavor follows suit with ample amounts of dark cocoa, dry cocoa roast, toasted mocha, along with the sweet, toasted caramel malt. Some piney hops add balancing bitterness on the back end. The palate is exactly as it should be with a medium body and almost creamy mouthfeel with perfect carbonation leading to a roasted cocoa finish. Quite different from most CCB beers as they tend to be quite substantial on the palate. Delicious stuff that I could drink multiple pints of and be quite happy. Definitely one of the better beers that Cigar City has made in awhile. Really good beer here.

From the growler. Reddish black pour with a thin light tan head. Huge roasted grain aroma with smoky notes and a hint of chocolate. Nice malt body, not too heavy with lots of roasted grain, chocolate and a roasted bitterness on the finish. Very well done.

My Bottom Line :  
Prominent roasted malts and their coffee bean angles dominate this lagers date and vanilla-like fruitiness for a sweet but quite flavorful pint.

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A ring of foam circles the blackness with dark brown hues.
-The low carbonation makes the sugars feel bigger. 
-This is rather drinkable but it is obviously brewed to suit North Americans tastes for bolder brews. This is richer than any authentic Schwarzbier Ive had.
-Mouthfeel is slick and silky.

On tap at Coffee District, Delray Beach.

Draft at Brass Tap: Poured a deep dark brown/black with a reddish hint. Sweet roasted malt aroma. Taste is a bold malt with spices and molasses. The Germans who follow the code would roll over if they tried this example of Schwarzbier!

32 oz. swing top growler via trade with 	
smith4498 - Pours a dark brown color with a one finger thick tan head.  Light spotty lacing.  Aroma is roasted, almost burnt malt.  Flavor is lightly sweetened roasted malt and light chocolate with some herbal hops trying to bust out.  Finish is smooth and roasty.  Medium body.  Schwarzbier beers are probably my favorite style of Lagers and this is a good one.  Thanks Jason.

Draft at CCB. Nose is heavy roast with some light chocolate and hay. Pour is dark brown with a decent head. Taste touches on roasted notes and some light coffee and chocolate flavors with a bit of hay and straw notes in the mix. Not bad.

Growler at one of Damicos tastings. Nose is bacon and  roasted malt. First sip is malty flavors of licorice, chicory andblack strap molasses . Finish has nice bitterness but not necessarily from hops.

Pours dark black coffee with an amber hue and decent creamy caramel head. The aroma brings pleasant roasted malts, fresh coffee, and black licorice. It tastes very similar, starts with light sweet roasted malty coffee notes that taste so fresh and delicious. The body is just right, not crispy or creamy, but so smooth.
roasted grains dominate, though it finished a bit thin with a hoppiness that sort of throws it off. not bad but not that interesting either.

Multiple draft samples at Redlight.  Oh yeah....now were talking.  A 5.5% Schwarz from my local brewery?  Sign me up!  This sucker pours dark and chocolaty, just a bit of light peeking through its mahogany edges.  A thick and frothy cap of mocha foam sits steadfast at the head, leaving traces of tattered, wet lace on the glass as it slowly settles to a swirly surface film.  The nose is big on roast, suggesting of dry chocolate and mocha most prominently, touching on sharper coffee edges at times, along with rich, blackened caramel.  Its really nicely balanced and approachable, yet loaded with character.  Flavors are largely the same, though they take on a bit more fruitiness.  I get cocoa beans, dry cacao roast, roasted mocha, and a caramel finish.  Mmmmm....tasty!  The palate might be my favorite part of this beer.  It is notably less substantive than most CCB beers, yet still sufficiently creamy, and perfectly, I mean perfectly carbonated.  Damn fine beer here.  This is the best CCB brew Ive had in some time.  Can this stuff please!

Had this on tap at Willards Tap House in largo fla. Looks like a stout. Mild easy aroma of stout. Friendly and fun, to an extent. Not overwhelming but there is a roasted slighjt burnt finish.  Bitterness also builds on the finish.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: On tap at Redlight. Dark brown with a tan head. Scent is roasty. Taste is same with a lot of coffee.
on tap-pours a dissipating tan head with black color.  Aroma is dark malt-molasses.  Taste is roasty dark malt/oat-molasses/peat, spice/earthy hops.  Full body, chewy.

Draft at World of Beer.  Dark brown, near black pour with a chocolate tan head.  Aroma has a good bit of roasted malt, dark chocolate and smokiness.  Wasnt crazy about the flavor, too much smokiness without some of the other flavors I was expecting to balance it out.  I love Cigar City, but this was not my favorite from them...still, a lesser Cigar City beer is still better than most.

draft @ redlight redlight.  Roasted malts on the nose with notes of chocolate and charcoal.  Pours very dark brown/black with a thick off white head.  Pretty thick mouthfeel, rich and chocolatey with hints of smoke and bitter bakers chocolate.  Pretty good.   Flavor is great just pretty thick for a schwarzbier, reminds more of a baltic porter.

11/27/11. Growler courtesy rbrazell! Thanks, man! Pitch black pour, slight ruby edges under the light, with a nice tan head that holds, sticks, and laces in streaks. Nice aroma of chocolate, cocoa powder, roasted malts, and a touch of graininess. Wonderful chocolate flavor, milk chocolate, with a touch of fruitiness and graininess. Smooth, almost creamy mouthfeel, but well carbonated. This has all the flavors of an awesome porter but with the easy-drinking smoothness of a lager. Delish!

Growler  Fantômepalooza 2011 Pours coal black with a mid-sized, creamy, khaki head. Good retention. The bouquet is very rich and roasty  mocha, chocolate crème and vanilla. Medium to full-bodied with jazzy carbonation. Roasty and a touch acrid. Moderately tangy. Burnt mocha finish. Kudos to Dstructo for sharing this beer!
A top notch black lager from Cigar City.  Good chocolately malt tones with a hint of roasted coffee and toffee with a very modest hop character.

Pours dark brown with a eggshell colored head. Nose is lots of deep roast, chocolate and nice smoke. Flavor is a great roastiness with touches of smoke. Very nice and easy drinking sessionable beer. Fantastic.
I really love the new black lager, and a session beer as well! Nice dark pour, chocolate with a tastefull amount of smokeiness. Tastes great, another winner from CCB!!

On draft at Cigar City.  Another awesome lager from CCB!  Pours a dark cola brown with an off-white head.  Nose is some roasted malts, some earth, some slight smoke, some dry chocolate and cocoa.  Flavor is similar with hints of chocolate, earth, bits of smoke, and roasted malts.  Clean in the finish with just a hint of lingering smoke.  Light to medium in body and overall an enjoyable lager.
